snippet: With the zoo population about to change yet again, a look back at how Central Park became the repository for animals cast off or donated by New York citizens and visitors.
abstract: Depiction of how Central Park Zoo became repository for animals cast off or donated by New York citizens and visitors noted; procession of animals began in 1859, when trained bear cub was dropped off to some guards at park and, as years went on, trickle of live gifts grew steadier and more exotic; zoo officials say more animals are coming soon, including what may replace Gus, beloved polar bear who died in summer 2013.
lead_paragraph: With the zoo population about to change yet again, a look back at how Central Park became the repository for animals cast off or donated by New York citizens and visitors.

headline.main: Giving Life to Central Park Zoo, One Donation at a Time
headline.print_headline: Giving Life to a Zoo, One Donation at a Time
